Biochemistry.summary: Tayside and Fife labs biochemistry data. This data is provided in a format based upon the SCI-Store system.

Field.name: ArithmeticComparator
Field.summary: This field represents additional information to be used in conjunction with the numeric result field Result. The contents should be interpreted along with the Result, for example, some EGFR results may be reported as Result = 60, with ArithmeticComparator = '>' This means the result is greater than 60.

Field.name: Interpretation
Field.summary: Contains comments regarding the result.

Field.name: Healthboard
Field.summary: This is the alpha and/or numeric Health Board code in which the patient CHI information was extracted from.

Field.name: SampleDate
Field.summary: This is the date and time when the sample was taken from the patient.

Field.name: SampleType
Field.summary: The type of sample that was run e.g. 'Blood', 'Serum' etc.

Field.name: TestCode
Field.summary: This field store the test code for the test taken/performed (e.g., CHOL = Cholesterol) as used by the providing organisation. This is the internal lab system identifier for the test being run (See ReadCodeValue for a coded answer). Includes non clinical/message codes such as ECOM.

Field.name: Result
Field.summary: Numerical measure captured during the test (expressed in QuantityUnit units)

Field.name: LabNumber
Field.summary: This is a unique identifier assigned by the lab system to identify a sample run. Each sample run can have multiple tests run.

Field.name: QuantityUnit
Field.summary: The unit of measure that the Result is expressed in e.g. "mmol/L" / "umol/L".

Field.name: ReadCodeValue
Field.summary: The read code allocated to the test. This field is useful as a standardised grouping for the tests, for example, if you are looking in Serum Total Cholesterol, all records marked with 44P. represent this regardless of the TestCode provided.

Field.name: RangeLowValue
Field.summary: Minimum guideline value for the test result at the time of testing. These ranges vary based on relevant criteria such as age, gender, and guidelines will also change over time.

Field.name: RangeHighValue
Field.summary: Maximum guideline value for the test result at the time of testing. These ranges vary based on relevant criteria such as age, gender, and guidelines will also change over time.

Demography.summary: Address and patient details as might appear in the CHI register

Field.name: Forename
Field.summary: Patients forename, randomly generated from a list of 100 common forenames that match the patients gender

Field.name: Surname
Field.summary: patients surname, randomly generated from a list of 100 common surnames

Field.name: ANOCHI
Field.summary: Anonymous identifier that has replaced the identifiable CHI. Typically represented as aaa1234567 where the first three letters uniquely identify a project (allowing for project specific anonymisation)

Field.name: DateOfBirth
Field.summary: Date of birth of the patient, this should match the first 6 digits of the CHI

Field.name: DateOfDeath
Field.summary: If the patient is dead then this date will be filled in with the date it occurred

Field.name: Gender
Field.summary: M for Male patient, F for Female patient. Should match the second last digit of the CHI (if the patient has a CHI and not an ANOCHI) with odd numbers for females and even numbers for males. This reflects the physical sex at birth and not what the person may identify as now.

Field.name: Address
Field.summary: The address which the patient lives at at the time of the EHR record being generated

Field.name: PreviousAddress
Field.summary: The previous address which the patient lived at when the EHR record being generated

Field.name: dtCreated
Field.summary: The date the patient registered with the GP (when the chi record was created).

Field.name: current_record
Field.summary: 1 if the record is still active in the given healthboard (e.g.. Tayside) or 0 if a more recent record exists in another healthboard (i.e. they are known to have moved out of the area or if ISD no longer supplies the record). Note that if your research project only covers Tayside then you would not necessarily get a record with 1 if they moved to Glasgow but would still get the old record from Tayside with 0 for current record.

Field.name: chi_num_of_curr_record
Field.summary: Indicates that the chi number recorded (in the chi field) is out of date and that the person should actually be known by this alias. This occurs when a patient doesn't know their chi or is unable to supply it (e.g. an emergency appointment while on holiday).

Field.name: chi_status
Field.summary: Indicates whether the chi record is current or not, see lookup z_chiStatus

Field.name: century
Field.summary: This field contains a 2-digit century of when a person was born (e.g., 19 = born between 1800 - 1899 ; 20 = born between 1900 - 1999; and 21 = born from 2000 onwards).

Field.name: current_address_L1
Field.summary: Current known patient address line 1

Field.name: current_address_L2
Field.summary: Current known patient address line 2

Field.name: current_address_L3
Field.summary: Current known patient address line 3

Field.name: current_address_L4
Field.summary: Current known patient address line 4

Field.name: current_postcode
Field.summary: Current patient's Postcode

Field.name: source_death
Field.summary: Contains a C if the source of the death information is CHI snapshots, or a G if the source of the death was General Registrar of Deaths (GRO). If the information is in both GRO and CHI then the code GC will appear.

Field.name: area_residence
Field.summary: Healthboard that the patient is currently residing in (may be different from the healthboard they are registered with - hb_extract)

Field.name: hb_extract
Field.summary: This field represents the alpha and/or numeric Health Board code in which the patient CHI information was extracted from.

Field.name: current_gp
Field.summary: GP Code of the patients currently registered GP

Field.name: birth_surname
Field.summary: Patients surname at birth

Field.name: previous_surname
Field.summary: Patients previous surname (e.g. if married)

Field.name: midname
Field.summary: Patients middle name

Field.name: alt_forename
Field.summary: An alternative name patient goes by

Field.name: other_initials
Field.summary: Middle name initials (if any) the patient goes by

Field.name: previous_address_L1
Field.summary: Patients previous address line 1

Field.name: previous_address_L2
Field.summary: Patients previous address line 2

Field.name: previous_address_L3
Field.summary: Patients previous address line 3

Field.name: previous_address_L4
Field.summary: Patients previous address line 4

Field.name: previous_postcode
Field.summary: Patients previous address postcode

Field.name: date_address_changed
Field.summary: The date when the patient moved from their previous address to the current address.

Field.name: current_gp_accept_date
Field.summary: This is the date when the patient was accepted onto current GP list.

Field.name: previous_gp
Field.summary: GP Code of the patients previously registered GP

Field.name: previous_gp_accept_date
Field.summary: Date patient registered with previous GP

Field.name: date_into_practice
Field.summary: This field represents the date when a person came into the health board region and registered with that health board GP.

Field.name: hic_dataLoadRunID
Field.summary: Indicates which data load execution batch (if any) was responsible for creating the record

member.name: T:SynthEHR.Datasets.HospitalAdmissionsRecord
member.summary: Random record for when a entered hospital. Basic logic is implemented here to ensure that is after and that the person was alive at the time.

Field.name: AdmissionDate
Field.summary: Date patient was admitted to hospital

Field.name: DischargeDate
Field.summary: Date patient was discharged from hospital (or died).

Field.name: MainCondition
Field.summary: The primary presenting condition and the reason for hospitalisation. This is either an ICD10 code or an ICD9 code. ICD9 codes are preceded by a minus symbol to distinguish them.

Field.name: OtherCondition1
Field.summary: The second condition for hospitalisation. This is either an ICD10 code or an ICD9 code. ICD9 codes are preceded by a minus symbol to distinguish them.

Field.name: OtherCondition2
Field.summary: The tertiary condition for hospitalisation. This is either an ICD10 code or an ICD9 code. ICD9 codes are preceded by a minus symbol to distinguish them.

Field.name: OtherCondition3
Field.summary: The forth condition for hospitalisation. This is either an ICD10 code or an ICD9 code. ICD9 codes are preceded by a minus symbol to distinguish them.

Field.name: MainOperation
Field.summary: The main operation is that selected by the clinician responsible for the care of the patient. Part A is used for single codes or for the primary part of a recognised code-pair.

Field.name: MainOperationB
Field.summary: The main operation is that selected by the clinician responsible for the care of the patient. Part B is used for Core Approach, Technique, Site or Laterality codes or for the supplementary part of a recognised code-pair.

Field.name: OtherOperation1
Field.summary: This field represents other operation entered in the order specified by the clinician. Part A is used for single codes or for the primary part of a recognised code-pair.

Field.name: OtherOperation1B
Field.summary: This field represents other operation entered in the order specified by the clinician. Part B is used for Approach, Technique, Site or Laterality codes or for the supplementary part of a recognised code-pair.

Field.name: OtherOperation2
Field.summary: This field represents other operation entered in the order specified by the clinician. Part A is used for single codes or for the primary part of a recognised code-pair.

Field.name: OtherOperation2B
Field.summary: This field represents other operation entered in the order specified by the clinician. Part B is used for Approach, Technique, Site or Laterality codes or for the supplementary part of a recognised code-pair.

Field.name: OtherOperation3
Field.summary: This field represents other operation entered in the order specified by the clinician. Part A is used for single codes or for the primary part of a recognised code-pair.

Field.name: OtherOperation3B

Maternity.summary: Tayside and Fife births record. Contains the parents and children birthed during the admission. This data is provided in a format based upon the Scottish SMR02 dataset

Field.name: MotherCHI
Field.summary: Unique identifier of the pregnant mother of the baby being born

Field.name: SendingLocation
Field.summary: This field indicates the location of where the data was sent from. This is not necessarily the same place as where the episode took place.

Field.name: EpisodeRecordKey
Field.summary: Unique identifier indicating a specific case record

Field.name: MaritalStatus
Field.summary: This field represents the mother's marital status. At a certain date ISD stopped using numbers in this column and started using letters. If this field contains a letter (A-Z), see lookup table z_MaritalStatus

Field.name: Specialty
Field.summary: A specialty is defined as a division of medicine or dentistry covering a specific area of clinical activity and identified within one of the Royal Colleges or Faculties.

Field.name: Location
Field.summary: This field represents the location code at which health activity takes place. In other words, the location code represents the point of delivery of health care.

Field.name: Healthboard
Field.summary: Single letter code describing which NHS healthboard the record came from e.g. T for Tayside, F for Fife

Field.name: Date
Field.summary: The date of admission to the birthing unit

Field.name: PartnerCHI
Field.summary: Unique identifier of the second contributor of genetic material for the babies being born or null if baby is a clone

Field.name: BabyCHI1
Field.summary: Unique identifier of the first baby to be born

Field.name: BabyCHI2
Field.summary: Unique identifier of the second baby to be born (if twins)

Field.name: BabyCHI3
Field.summary: Unique identifier of the third baby to be born (if triplets)

member.name: T:SynthEHR.Person
member.summary: Randomly generated person for whom datasets can be built

Field.name: Forename
Field.summary: Patients forename, randomly generated from a list of 100 common forenames that match the patients gender

Field.name: Surname
Field.summary: patients surname, randomly generated from a list of 100 common surnames

Field.name: chi
Field.summary: Community Health Index (CHI) number is a unique personal identifier allocated to each patient on first registration with a GP Practice. It follows the format DDMMYYRRGC where DDMMYY represents the persons date of birth, RR are random digits, G is another random digit but acts as a gender identifier, (where odd numbers indicate males and even numbers indicate females), and the final digit is an arithmetical check digit.

Field.name: ANOCHI
Field.summary: Anonymous identifier that has replaced the identifiable CHI. Typically represented as aaa1234567 where the first three letters uniquely identify a project (allowing for project specific anonymisation)

Field.name: DateOfBirth
Field.summary: Date of birth of the patient, this should match the first 6 digits of the CHI

Field.name: DateOfDeath
Field.summary: If the patient is dead then this date will be filled in with the date it occurred

Field.name: Gender
Field.summary: M for Male patient, F for Female patient. Should match the second last digit of the CHI (if the patient has a CHI and not an ANOCHI) with odd numbers for females and even numbers for males. This reflects the physical sex at birth and not what the person may identify as now.

Field.name: Address
Field.summary: The address which the patient lives at at the time of the EHR record being generated

Field.name: PreviousAddress
Field.summary: The previous address which the patient lived at when the EHR record being generated
